page.title: 06CRAIGROTHIE AND CHANCE INN
page.content: The hamlet of Craigrothie has a pub and a school. There used to be a shop in the pub building but it closed years ago. Daily papers are collected from Ceres by one of the villagers who then sells them. There are several newly built houses and modernised houses and cottages. There are also some Local Authority houses most of which have been bought by the tenants.Craigrothie is in a conservation ares which makes new building very difficult. The hamlet will not grow much which means that the school roll is falling.Some building is going on in Chance Inn.
